text:
We just posted a complete draft of our new book, Algorithms for Decision Making:
<http://algorithmsbook.com/>
It uses JuMP.jl for many of the key algorithms. If you have comments on how it can be improved, please let us know!

elements.text: We just posted a complete draft of our new book, Algorithms for Decision Making:
It uses JuMP.jl for many of the key algorithms. If you have comments on how it can be improved, please let us know!

text:
I have been looking for this. Really liked the previous book.
Will it be available for purchase as a PDF?
Will you consider services that allow rolling releases of purchased book (Namely the PDF is updated when errors are fixed)?

text: looks really nice.  It looks like it's all Julia, is that the case?

elements.text: looks really nice.  It looks like it's all Julia, is that the case?

text: This is awesome. Seems like I can learn a lot from it. Just curious if there will be any HTML version too?

elements.text: This is awesome. Seems like I can learn a lot from it. Just curious if there will be any HTML version too?

text: We are still many months away from a print version. But, even once it goes into print, we will keep the PDF available for free. The PDF will be updated if there are errata. Everything is in Julia. There are no immediate plans for an HTML version, but we can look into it.

elements.text: We are still many months away from a print version. But, even once it goes into print, we will keep the PDF available for free. The PDF will be updated if there are errata. Everything is in Julia. There are no immediate plans for an HTML version, but we can look into it.
